intro: Hieracium rupicarpum, commonly known as rock-hedgerug, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the daisy family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its yellow-orange composite flowers and hairy, often glandular leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly habitats, such as cliffs, walls, and roadside banks. It produces small, oval-shaped fruits called cypsela, which are dispersed by wind. Hieracium rupicarpum is often found in disturbed or marginal environments, showing adaptability to harsh conditions.
